repos_url.name: khan-mobile
repos_url.description: You’re probably looking for www.github.com/khan/mobile

repos_url.name: khan-api
repos_url.description: Documentation for (and examples of) using the Khan Academy API

repos_url.name: gae_mini_profiler
repos_url.description: A ubiquitous mini-profiler for Google App Engine, inspired by mvc-mini-profiler

repos_url.name: sandcastle
repos_url.description: Test pull requests from your browser. (deprecated)

repos_url.name: gae_bingo
repos_url.description: Ready-in-minutes split-testing framework for App Engine, built for Khan Academy and inspired by A/Bingo

repos_url.name: live-editor
repos_url.description: A browser-based live coding environment.

repos_url.name: kiln-review
repos_url.description: A mercurial extension that allows you to create kiln code reviews via hg

repos_url.name: snippets
repos_url.description: Code related to collecting and pushing weekly snippets

repos_url.name: internal-webserver
repos_url.description: Code that runs on the khan-academy webserver ec2 instance (for dev tools and the like)

repos_url.name: rbtools
repos_url.description: Command line tools for working with Review Board

repos_url.name: reviewboard
repos_url.description: A powerful Web 2.0 code review tool

license.name: Do What The F*ck You Want To Public License

repos_url.name: production-rpc-webserver
repos_url.description: Production RPC servers for Khan Academy website features hosted in EC2.

repos_url.name: appengine-search
repos_url.description: Simple full text search demo for Google App Engine

repos_url.name: pyporter2
repos_url.description: A python implementation of the porter2 stemmer: http://snowball.tartarus.org/algorithms/english/stemmer.html

repos_url.name: flask
repos_url.description: A microframework based on Werkzeug, Jinja2 and good intentions

repos_url.name: werkzeug
repos_url.description: A flexible WSGI implementation and toolkit

repos_url.name: werkzeug-debugger-appengine
repos_url.description: Monkey patch for werkzeug debugger to use jinja2 and other fixes for app engine compatibility

repos_url.name: mercurial-plugin
repos_url.description: Jenkins mercurial plugin

repos_url.name: arcanist
repos_url.description: Arcanist is the CLI to Differential, Facebook's code review tool. Currently an unstable preview release.

repos_url.name: phabricator
repos_url.description: An early release of Facebook's development tools.

repos_url.name: python-phabricator
repos_url.description: Python bindings for Phabricator

repos_url.name: analytics
repos_url.description: Tools to analyze KA logs and other data

repos_url.name: khan-dotfiles
repos_url.description: Dotfiles for Khan Academy website developers.

repos_url.name: libphutil
repos_url.description: libphutil is a collection of utility classes for PHP. Currently an unstable preview release.

repos_url.name: khan-linter
repos_url.description: Lint and code-munging tools for Khan Academy codebase

repos_url.name: gae-default-version-notifier
repos_url.description: Notify HipChat when a new version of the Khan Academy website is set as default

repos_url.name: beep-boop
repos_url.description: Automated issue-frequency HipChat notifier

repos_url.name: gae-continuous-deploy
repos_url.description: A server which polls a repository and automatically deploys to Google App engine

pull_request.title: Version Packages
pull_request.body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @khanacademy/wonder-blocks-birthday-picker@1.2.9

### Patch Changes

-   Updated dependencies [d0a76cf5]
    -   @khanacademy/wonder-blocks-dropdown@2.7.3

## @khanacademy/wonder-blocks-dropdown@2.7.3

### Patch Changes

-   d0a76cf5: Add live region to announce the number of options (fixing an iOS issue)

repo.name: wonder-blocks
repo.description: React components for Wonder Blocks design system.

repo.name: wonder-blocks
repo.description: React components for Wonder Blocks design system.

issue.title: Bump @google-cloud/profiler from 4.1.7 to 4.2.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [@google-cloud/profiler](https://github.com/googleapis/cloud-profiler-nodejs) from 4.1.7 to 4.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from @​google-cloud/profiler's releases.

v4.2.0

4.2.0 (2022-05-13)

Bug Fixes

  • initial module in golint presubmit check (#818) (df1f28a)
  • library should released as 4.2.0 (#833) (8d722aa)
  • relax service name requirements to allow starting with numbers (#828) (fe0f1cc)
Changelog

Sourced from @​google-cloud/profiler's changelog.

4.2.0 (2022-05-13)

Bug Fixes

  • initial module in golint presubmit check (#818) (df1f28a)
  • library should released as 4.2.0 (#833) (8d722aa)
  • relax service name requirements to allow starting with numbers (#828) (fe0f1cc)
Commits
  • c224211 chore(main): release 4.2.0 (#834)
  • 8d722aa fix: library should released as 4.2.0 (#833)
  • c52cdea chore(deps): update dependency @​types/mocha to v9 (#825)
  • 3af4b9d chore(deps): update dependency sinon to v14 (#831)
  • cd0aed5 test: add node 16 and remove windows from github workflow (#830)
  • fe0f1cc fix: relax service name requirements to allow starting with numbers (#828)
  • 810c3e5 build(node): update client library version in samples metadata (#1356) (#822)
  • 1bba983 Revert "fix: clarify the gax-nodejs usage in README (#1352)" (#1409) (#817)
  • 0e1b16c chore(deps): update dependency python to v3.10.4 (#1386) (#815)
  • 4b6f4fb chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v3 (#1392) (#814)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=@google-cloud/profiler&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.1.7&new-version=4.2.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=h1&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan) Report
> Merging [#842](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan) (6241cf9) into [main](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/commit/805880c138867019ceba3672715f4482cbcb9434?el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan) (805880c) will **not change** coverage.
> The diff coverage is `n/a`.


[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&height=150&src=pr&token=dJBz8T4PlI&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan)](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=tree&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan)

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff            @@
##              main      #842   +/-   ##
=========================================
  Coverage   100.00%   100.00%           
=========================================
  Files           52        52           
  Lines          715       715           
  Branches       149       149           
=========================================
  Hits           715       715           
```



------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=continue&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=footer&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan). Last update [805880c...6241cf9](https://codecov.io/gh/Khan/render-gateway/pull/842?src=pr&el=lastupdated&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=Khan).

pull_request.title: Bump jest from 28.0.3 to 28.1.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [jest](https://github.com/facebook/jest/tree/HEAD/packages/jest) from 28.0.3 to 28.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from jest's releases.

v28.1.0

Features

  • [jest-circus] Add failing test modifier that inverts the behaviour of tests (#12610)
  • [jest-environment-node, jest-environment-jsdom] Allow specifying customExportConditions (#12774)

Fixes

  • [expect] Adjust typings of lastCalledWith, nthCalledWith, toBeCalledWith matchers to allow a case there a mock was called with no arguments (#12807)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS Lists (#12763)
  • [jest-core] Do not collect SIGNREQUEST as open handles (#12789)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [docs] Specified documentation about --filter CLI docs (#12799)
  • [@jest-reporters] Move helper functions from utils.ts into separate files (#12782)
  • [jest-resolve] Replace process.versions.pnp type declaration with @types/pnpapi devDependency (#12783)

New Contributors

  • @​romellem made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12763
  • @​cristianrgreco made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12789
  • @​rethab made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12791
  • @​gramsco made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12799
  • @​michalwarda made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12610
  • @​mikemaccana made their first contribution in facebook/jest#12809

Full Changelog: https://github.com/facebook/jest/compare/v28.0.3...v28.1.0

Changelog

Sourced from jest's changelog.

28.1.0

Features

  • [jest-circus] Add failing test modifier that inverts the behaviour of tests (#12610)
  • [jest-environment-node, jest-environment-jsdom] Allow specifying customExportConditions (#12774)

Fixes

  • [expect] Adjust typings of lastCalledWith, nthCalledWith, toBeCalledWith matchers to allow a case there a mock was called with no arguments (#12807)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS Lists (#12763)
  • [jest-core] Do not collect SIGNREQUEST as open handles (#12789)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [docs] Specified documentation about --filter CLI docs (#12799)
  • [@jest-reporters] Move helper functions from utils.ts into separate files (#12782)
  • [jest-resolve] Replace process.versions.pnp type declaration with @types/pnpapi devDependency (#12783)
Commits
  • f5db241 v28.1.0
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=jest&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=28.0.3&new-version=28.1.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

review.body: LGTM.  Thanks for adding stories and docs for these things. 💚

pull_request.title: WB-1132.1: Add SB docs for addStyle and View
pull_request.body:
## Summary:

- Added Storybook documentation for `View` (including a couple of new examples).
- Migrated `addStyle` docs and refactored the documentation a bit.
- Removed `enumerate-scroll-ancestors.js` b/c it's not being used anymore.

NOTE: First PR for migrating `wb-core` to Storybook (1/3).

Issue: WB-1132

## Test plan:

Navigate to SB under the `core/` section and verify the documentation for `View` and `addStyle`.

View: https://5e1bf4b385e3fb0020b7073c-qnuztwnegk.chromatic.com/?path=/docs/core-view--default
addStyle: https://5e1bf4b385e3fb0020b7073c-qnuztwnegk.chromatic.com/?path=/docs/core-addstyle--with-default-style

repo.name: wonder-blocks
repo.description: React components for Wonder Blocks design system.

repo.name: wonder-blocks
repo.description: React components for Wonder Blocks design system.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -45,16 +49,23 @@ const StyledSection = addStyle<"section">("section", styles.default);
 
 /**
  * View is a building block for constructing other components. `View` roughly
- * maps to `div` and `Text` roughly maps to `span`. You can override which tag
- * is used to render the component (for semantic purposes) by specifying the
- * `tag` prop.
+ * maps to `div`. You can override which tag is used to render the component
+ * (for semantic purposes) by specifying the `tag` prop.
  *
  * These components can take styles (via the `style` prop) in a variety of
  * manners:
  *
  * - An inline style object
  * - An `aphrodite` StyleSheet style
  * - An array combining the above
comment.body:
One thing that's missing that should probably be add is a description of the default styling for `View`s, in particular:
- use flexbox by default
- flex-direction is set to `column`
- they each get their own stacking context

Additionally, you may want to include what the inspiration and rationale were for these choices.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,98 +0,0 @@
-// @flow
-/**
- * Utility for finding the scroll ancestors of a child
- *
- * Inspired by https://github.com/olahol/scrollparent.js
- * with modifications to make an iterator that returns a sequence of all scroll
- * ancestors.
- *
- * Also modified for our standards (and commented a bit).
- */
comment.body: Are we not using this any more?
